channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tanner's Hill Dumped Chairs Blocking Pathway, 24th August
item.description:
Tanner's Hill Accessibly issue on pathway across rail bridge due to several dumped chairs and wooden boards. Reported on Love Clean Streets from 14/8/25, however cases were closed without clearing up. More chairs have been dumped here since.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tanners Hill, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open and overflowing commercial bin AGAIN from Pepe's commercial waste, 24th August
item.description:
We didn't go one single day without Pepe's shop not following the commercial waste council rules that requires bin to be closed and not overflowing. Something needs to be done with this - either fix for good or remove their license and close this shop. They have been doing this for 18 months now. We had enought.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven surface, 24th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 766, Holloway Road, Archway, London

item.title: Ramillies road needs re-surfacing, 24th August
item.description:
Right where do I start. The whole of ramillies needs resurfacing! The state of the road is appalling. Everytime the B13 comes past it makes my windows shake and wakes me up! This is causing damage to vehicles driving down this road and it is not on. It’s not a case of filling in all the holes and massive cracks in the road it’s a case of ripping the road up and putting down a new road PROPERLY. What’s the point in paying road tax when the roads that we drive on are killing the suspension and tyres in my car. BEXLEY COUNCIL NEED TO SORT THIS OUT!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Ramillies Road, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Last report states fixed this is not so., 24th August
item.description:
Blue bins with no lids constantly filled and over flowing with all kinds of rubbish and not recycling as should be . Foxes climbing all over .problem is constantly and has been for the past 2 years but getting worse .. Council should make owners of these properties keep there bins on there own property and not on the pavement. And make sure the bin collection take these excess bins away .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plough Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water escaping from Water cover in pavement, 24th August
item.description:
Water has been leaking out of a water cover on pavement for the last week and is escaping onto the main road (Devonshire Road/7-14 Facade) and opposite estate agents Leaders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Devonshire Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signs showing resident parking only restrictions for Notting Hill Carnival weekend have been ripped down, 24th August
item.description:
Signs showing resident parking only restrictions for Notting Hill Carnival weekend have been deliberately ripped down or had the date sticker removed from the sign. This is all along Goldney Road between the junction with Marylands Road and Neeld Place. This means it is unclear that non residents can't park here, and so the street is jam packed with cars, meaning residents can't park. Please can someone replace the signs before the Monday of Carnival, as the parking tends to be even worse on Monday. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Goldney Road, Maida Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins of 15 tunnel avenue are always overflowing, 24th August
item.description:
The buns at 15 tunnel avenue are always overflowing and cause issues with birds, foxes and other animals. It is disgusting and it happens every week - and this has been going on for months. The photos are as of 24 August 2025

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Tunnel Avenue, East Greenwich, London
